original: Udāna 5.5
analyzed: udāna
translated: The Collection of Long Discourses 1.1

original: Uposathasutta
analyzed: uposatha sutta
translated: The Uposatha

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in the Eastern Park in the Mansion of Migāra’s Mother.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto nisinno hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhu saṅgha parivutaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti
translated: Now on that occasion the Blessed One was seated, surrounded by the community of bhikkhus.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante paṭhame yāme, uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ abhikkantāya rattiyā nikkhante paṭhame yāme uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then, when the night had advanced, the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, and after arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he extended his hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One and said to him:

original: “abhikkantā, bhante, ratti; nikkhanto paṭhamo yāmo; ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: abhikkantā bhante ratti nikkhantaḥ paṭhhamaḥ yāmaḥ cira nisinnaḥ bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: “Venerable sir, the night has advanced, the first watch of the night has passed, and the community of bhikkhus has been sitting a long time.

original: uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṁ pātimokkhan”ti.
analyzed: uddisatu bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātimokkham ti
translated: Let the Blessed One recite the Pāṭimokkha to the bhikkhus.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One was silent.

original: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante majjhime yāme, uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho āyasmai ānandaḥ abhikkantāya rattiyā nikkhante majjhime yāme uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A second time, when the night had advanced, the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, and after arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he extended his hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One and said to him:

original: “abhikkantā, bhante, ratti; nikkhanto majjhimo yāmo; ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: abhikkantā bhante ratti nikkhantaḥ majjhimaḥ yāmaḥ cira nisinnaḥ bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: “Venerable Sir, the night has passed, the middle part of the night has passed. The Sangha of monks has been sitting here a long time.

original: uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṁ pātimokkhan”ti.
analyzed: uddisatu bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātimokkham ti
translated: Please recite the Monastic Code.”

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.🔽Tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando abhikkantāya rattiyā, nikkhante pacchime yāme, uddhaste
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi  tatiyam pi kho āyasmai ānandaḥ abhikkantāya rattiyā nikkhante pacchime yāme uddhaste
translated: For a second time the Buddha was silent.🔽For a third time, when the night was well advanced, the last part of the night remaining,

original: aruṇe, nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā
analyzed: aruṇe nandimukhiyā rattiyā uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā
translated: the dawn aglow, and the sky lightening, Ānanda got up from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tena añjalim paṇāmetvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: put his palms together and said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantā, bhante, ratti; nikkhanto pacchimo yāmo; uddhasto aruṇo; nandimukhī ratti; ciranisinno bhikkhusaṅgho;
analyzed: abhikkantā bhante ratti nikkhantaḥ pacchimaḥ yāmaḥ uddhastaḥ aruṇaḥ nandimukhī ratti cira nisinnaḥ bhikkhu saṅgho
translated: “Venerable Sir, the night has passed, the last part of the night remaining. The dawn aglow, the sky lightening. The Sangha of monks has been sitting here a long time.

original: uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṁ pātimokkhan”ti.
analyzed: uddisatu bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātimokkham ti
translated: Please recite the Monastic Code.”

original: “Aparisuddhā, ānanda, parisā”ti.
analyzed: a parisuddhā ānanda parisā ati
translated: “The gathering is not pure, Ānanda.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmataḥ mahāmoggallānassa etat ahosi
translated: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna thought,

original: “kaṁ nu kho bhagavā puggalaṁ sandhāya evamāha:
analyzed: kam nu khalu bhagavā puggalam sandhāya evam āha
translated: “For whom did the Buddha say this?

original: ‘aparisuddhā, ānanda, parisā’”ti?
analyzed: a parisuddhā ānanda parisā ati
translated: ‘The assembly is impure.’”

original: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno sabbāvantaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ cetasā ceto paricca manasākāsi.🔽Addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṁ puggalaṁ dussīlaṁ pāpadhammaṁ asuciṁ saṅkassarasamācāraṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ sabbāvantam bhikkhu saṅgham cetasā cetaḥ paricca manasā akāsi  addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ tam puggalam dussīlam pāpa dhammam asucim saṅkassara samācāra
translated: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna pervaded the whole of the sangha of monks with his mind.

original: paṭicchannakammantaṁ assamaṇaṁ samaṇapaṭiññaṁ abrahmacāriṁ brahmacāripaṭiññaṁ antopūtiṁ
analyzed: paṭicchanna kammantam a ssamaṇam samaṇa paṭiññam abrahmacārim brahmacāri paṭiññam antopūti
translated: He saw that person, who was immoral, of bad character, impure, of suspect behaviour, not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic, though claiming to be one, rotten inside, lustful, living the spiritual life out of necessity,

original: avassutaṁ kasambujātaṁ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: avassutam kasambujātam majjhe bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: sitting in the midst of the sangha of monks.

original: Disvāna uṭṭhāyāsanā yena so puggalo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṁ puggalaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvānaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā yena saḥ puggalaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tam puggalam etat avoca
translated: Seeing him, he got up from his seat, went to that person, and said to him,

original: “uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭhosi bhagavatā;
analyzed: uṭṭhehi āvuso diṭṭhaḥ asi bhagavatā
translated: “Get up, friend. You’ve been seen by the Buddha.

original: natthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ saṁvāso”ti.
analyzed: natthi te bhikkhūhi saddhim sa vāsaḥ ti
translated: You’re not in communion with the monks.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, so puggalo tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: evam vutte saḥ puggalaḥ tuṇhī ahosi
translated: But that person remained silent.

original: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṁ puggalaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho āyasmai mahāmoggallānaḥ tam puggalam etat avoca
translated: Mahāmoggallāna said this a second time,

original: “uṭṭhehi, āvuso, diṭṭhosi bhagavatā;
analyzed: uṭṭhehi āvuso diṭṭhaḥ asi bhagavatā
translated: “Get up, friend. You’ve been seen by the Buddha.

original: natthi te bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ saṁvāso”ti.
analyzed: natthi te bhikkhūhi saddhim sa vāsaḥ ti
translated: You are not in communion with the monks.”

original: Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi kho so puggalo tuṇhī ahosi.🔽Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṁ puggalaṁ bāhāyaṁ gahetvā bahidvārakoṭṭhakā nikkhāmetvā sūcighaṭikaṁ datvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho so puggalo tuṇhī ahosi  atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ tam puggalam bāhāyam gahetvā bahi dvāra koṭṭhakāḥ nikkhāmetvā sūci ghaṭikam da tvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A third time that person was silent.

original: “nikkhāmito, bhante, so puggalo mayā.
analyzed: nikkhāmitaḥ bhante saḥ puggalaḥ mayā
translated: Mahāmoggallāna then grabbed him by the arm, took him outside the gateway, locked the gateway, and went to the Buddha. He said, “I’ve taken that person outside.

original: Parisuddhā parisā.
analyzed: parisuddhā parisā
translated: The gathering is pure.

original: Uddisatu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhūnaṁ pātimokkhan”ti.
analyzed: uddisatu bhante bhagavā bhikkhūnam pātimokkham ti
translated: Please recite the Monastic Code to the monks.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, moggallāna, abbhutaṁ, moggallāna.
analyzed: acchariya moggallāna abbhuta moggallāna
translated: “It’s astonishing and amazing, Moggallāna,

original: Yāva bāhāgahaṇāpi nāma so moghapuriso āgamessatī”ti.
analyzed: yāva nāma saḥ mogha purisaḥ āgamessati iti
translated: that that foolish man has to be taken out by force.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha then said to the monks,

original: “na dānāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ito paraṁ uposathaṁ karissāmi, pātimokkhaṁ uddisissāmi.
analyzed: na dāna aha bhikkhave itas param uposatham karissāmi pātimokkham uddisissāmi
translated: “From now on I won’t do the observance-day ceremony or recite the Monastic Code.

original: Tumheva dāni, bhikkhave, ito paraṁ uposathaṁ kareyyātha, pātimokkhaṁ uddiseyyātha.
analyzed: tumhā iva dāni bhikkhave itas param uposatham kareyyātha pātimokkham uddiseyyātha
translated: From now on you should do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code.

original: Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṁ tathāgato aparisuddhāya parisāya uposathaṁ kareyya, pātimokkhaṁ uddiseyya.
analyzed: aṭṭhānam eta bhikkhave anavakāsaḥ yam tathāgataḥ a parisuddhāya parisāya uposatham kareyya pātimokkham uddiseyya
translated: It is impossible, monks, it cannot happen that the Tathāgata would perform the Uposatha and recite the Pāṭimokkha with an impure Saṅgha.

original: Aṭṭhime, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde acchariyā abbhutā dhammā, ye disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.
analyzed: aṭṭhime bhikkhave mahā samudde acchariyāḥ abbhutāḥ dhammāḥ ye disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti
translated: “Monks, there are these eight amazing & astounding qualities of the ocean because of which, as they see them, the asuras take delight in the ocean.

original: Katame aṭṭha?
analyzed: katame aṭṭha
translated: Which eight?

original: Mahāsamuddo, bhikkhave, anupubbaninno anupubbapoṇo anupubbapabbhāro, na āyatakeneva papāto.
analyzed: mahā samuddaḥ bhikkhave anupubba ninnaḥ anupubba poṇaḥ anupubba pabbhāraḥ na āyatakena iva papātaḥ
translated: “The ocean has a gradual shelf, a gradual slope, a gradual inclination, with a sudden drop-off only after a long stretch.

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo anupubbaninno anupubbapoṇo anupubbapabbhāro na āyatakeneva papāto;
analyzed: yam pi bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ anupubba ninnaḥ anupubba poṇaḥ anupubba pabbhāraḥ na āyatakena iva papātaḥ
translated: The fact that the ocean has a gradual shelf, a gradual slope, a gradual inclination, with a sudden drop-off only after a long stretch:

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde paṭhamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ṭhitadhammo velaṁ nātivattati.
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde paṭhamaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ ṭhita dhammaḥ velam na ativattati
translated: This is the first amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it, the asuras take delight in the ocean.🔽“And furthermore, the ocean is stable and does not overstep its tideline.

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ṭhitadhammo velaṁ nātivattati;
analyzed: yam pi bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ ṭhita dhammaḥ velam na ativattati
translated: The fact that the ocean is stable and does not overstep its tideline:

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde dutiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo na matena kuṇapena saṁvasati. Yaṁ hoti mahāsamudde mataṁ kuṇapaṁ taṁ khippameva tīraṁ vāheti, thalaṁ ussāreti.
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde dutiyaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ na matena kuṇapena savasati yam hoti mahā samudde matam kuṇapam tam khippam eva tīram vāheti thalam ussāreti
translated: This is the second amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it, the asuras take delight in the ocean.

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo na matena kuṇapena saṁvasati, yaṁ hoti mahāsamudde mataṁ kuṇapaṁ taṁ khippameva tīraṁ vāheti thalaṁ ussāreti;
analyzed: yam pi bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ na matena kuṇapena savasati yam hoti mahā samudde matam kuṇapam tam khippam eva tīram vāheti thalam ussāreti
translated: “And further, the ocean doesn’t tolerate a dead body. If there’s a dead body in the ocean, the ocean quickly hurls it up onto dry land.

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde tatiyo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyathidaṁ—gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde tatiyaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave yā kāci mahā nadiyaḥ sā iyyathidagaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū
translated: This is the third amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it, the asuras take delight in the ocean.

original: mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṁ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni; ‘mahāsamuddo’tveva saṅkhaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: mahī tāḥ mahā samuddam patvā jahanti purimāni nāma gottāni mahā samuddaḥ ūtvā iva saṅkham gacchanti
translated: “And further, all the great rivers—the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, the Mahī—on reaching the ocean, give up their former names and are simply called ‘ocean.’

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyathidaṁ—gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī tā mahāsamuddaṁ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, ‘mahāsamuddo’tveva saṅkhaṁ gacchanti;
analyzed: yat pi bhikkhave yā kāci mahā nadiyaḥ seyyathīdagaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī tāḥ mahā samuddam patvā jahanti purimāni nāma gottāni mahā samuddaḥ utvā iva saṅkham gacchanti
translated: And again, monks, whatever great rivers there are that flow down to the great ocean, whether the Ganges, the Yamunā, the Aciravatī, the Sarabhū, or the Mahī, they all, on reaching the great ocean, give up their former names and lineages and are simply called ‘the great ocean.’

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde catuttho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, yā ca loke savantiyo mahāsamuddaṁ appenti, yā ca antalikkhā dhārā papatanti, na tena mahāsamuddassa ūnattaṁ vā pūrattaṁ vā paññāyati.
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde catutthaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave yā ca loke savantiyaḥ mahā samuddam appenti yāḥ ca antalikkhāḥ dhārāḥ papatanti na tena mahā samuddassa ūnattam vā pūrattam vā paññāyati
translated: This is the fourth amazing and astounding quality of the great ocean because of which, monks, the devas and humans delight in the great ocean.🔽And again, monks, whatever streams there are that flow into the great ocean, and whatever rain falls into it from the sky, the great ocean is not thereby increased or decreased.

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, yā ca loke savantiyo mahāsamuddaṁ appenti, yā ca antalikkhā dhārā papatanti, na tena mahāsamuddassa ūnattaṁ vā pūrattaṁ vā paññāyati;
analyzed: yam pi bhikkhave yāḥ ca loke savantiyaḥ mahā samuddam appenti yāḥ ca antalikkhāḥ dhārāḥ papatanti na tena mahā samuddassa ūnattam vā pūrattam vā paññāyati
translated: And again, monks, whatever streams there are that flow into the great ocean, and whatever rain falls into it from the sky, the great ocean is not thereby increased or decreased.

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde pañcamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso.
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde pañcamaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ eka rasaḥ loṇa rasaḥ
translated: This is the fifth amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it again & again, the asuras take great joy in the ocean.

original: Yampi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo ekaraso loṇaraso;
analyzed: yam pi bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ eka rasaḥ loṇa rasaḥ
translated: “And furthermore, the ocean has a single taste — the taste of salt.

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde chaṭṭho acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde chaṭṭhaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti
translated: This is the sixth amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it again & again, the asuras take great joy in the ocean.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo bahuratano anekaratano. Tatrimāni ratanāni, seyyathidaṁ—muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavāḷaṁ rajataṁ jātarūpaṁ lohitaṅgo masāragallaṁ.🔽Yampi, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo bahuratano anekaratano, tatrimāni ratanāni, seyyathidaṁ—muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavāḷaṁ rajataṁ jātarūpaṁ lohitaṅgo masāragallaṁ;
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ bahu ratanaḥ aneka ratanaḥ tatra imāni ratanāni seyyathīdam uttā maṇi veḷuriyaḥ saṅkhaḥ silā pavāḷam rajatam jātarūpam lohitaṅgaḥ masāragalla 🔽yam pi bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ bahu ratanaḥ aneka ratanaḥ tatra imāni ratanāni seyyathīdam uttā maṇi veḷuriyaḥ saṅkhaḥ silā pavāḷam rajatam jātarūpam lohitaṅgaḥ masāragalla
translated: “And furthermore, the ocean is full of many kinds of treasures, such as pearls, sapphires, lapis lazuli, shells, quartz, coral, silver, gold, rubies, & cat’s eyes.🔽This is the seventh amazing & astounding quality of the ocean because of which, as they see it again & again, the asuras take great joy in the ocean.

original: ayaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde sattamo acchariyo abbhuto dhammo, yaṁ disvā disvā asurā mahāsamudde abhiramanti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo mahataṁ bhūtānaṁ āvāso. Tatrime bhūtā—timi timiṅgalo🔽timitimiṅgalo asurā nāgā gandhabbā. Santi mahāsamudde yojanasatikāpi attabhāvā, dviyojanasatikāpi
analyzed: bhikkhave mahā samudde sattamaḥ acchariyaḥ abbhutaḥ dhammaḥ yam disvā disvā asurāḥ mahā samudde abhiramanti  puna capara bhikkhave mahā samuddaḥ mahatam bhūtānam āvāsaḥ tatrime timiṅgalaḥ  timitimiṅgalaḥ asurāḥ nāgāḥ gandhabbāḥ santi mahā samudde yojana satikā api attabhāvāḥ dvi yojana satikā api
translated: This is the seventh wonderful and marvellous thing that the asuras see when they look at the ocean and delight in it.🔽‘Again, the ocean is the abode of great beings.
